description: From Eastern Algonquian, probably Powhatan, first recorded as assapanick in 1706.

entries.meaning: (Southern US, now uncommon) A flying squirrel, Glaucomys volans, the southern flying squirrel, found in the southern and eastern United States.
examples: A very keen observation, prolonged for some time, is necessary to follow an Assapan at all, to distinguish and understand the purport of its different movements,  [â€¦]
